div.bibl: Chicago Greek Daily, Feb. 13, 1930. FIRST ANNUAL BALL OF PLUTARCH SCHOOL

body.p: This entertainment and dance is given for the benefit of Plutarch School, which is in need of many things to carry on its work of teaching and preserving the language of our fathers.

The committee has spared no effort to make the affair a success and a pleasure to all who attend. Songs will be sung,and poems and dialogues will be recited by the pupils. It is, therefore, the duty of all who wish to see the progress of our children in America to support this enterprise.
